_meta.description: Fate-shift types with severity levels and narrative hooks

severities.catastrophic: Complete destruction, no return possible, legacy may be tainted
severities.major: Death with lasting influence (legacy, ghost, prophecy fulfilled)

narrativeHooks: Found slain in their chambers, door locked from within
Fell in battle, surrounded but fighting to the last
Poisoned at a feast, the cup still in their hand
Disappeared during a journey, only their horse returned
Died protecting someone they loved
Struck down by illness that none could cure
Executed publicly for crimes real or fabricated
Lost at sea during a storm
Killed by the very power they sought to control
Died of a broken heart after final betrayal
Vanished into the wilderness, presumed dead
Sacrificed themselves to save many

fall.description: Loss of power, status, or position

severities.catastrophic: Total lossâ€”exile, imprisonment, or complete disgrace
severities.major: Significant loss of position, recovery difficult but possible
severities.moderate: Noticeable decline in influence, must rebuild from weakened position
severities.minor: Reputation damaged, warning sign of worse to come

narrativeHooks: Secrets revealed in the public square
Allies turned against them one by one
Caught in corruption that could not be hidden
Lost a challenge that cost everything
Betrayed by the one they trusted most
Made an enemy of the wrong power
Failed at the crucial moment when it mattered most
Their protector could no longer shield them
The people they served turned their backs
Outmaneuvered by a younger, cleverer rival
Their lies caught up with them all at once
A single mistake cascaded into disaster

severities.catastrophic: Fully turned to darkness or opposition, irredeemable
severities.minor: Temptation acknowledged, first steps toward darkness

narrativeHooks: Made a deal they cannot escape
The ends began justifying the means
Power revealed their true nature
They became what they once fought against
The corruption spread slowly, unnoticed until too late
A single compromise opened the door to many more
They convinced themselves it was necessary
The darkness offered what the light could not

severities.catastrophic: Permanent banishment, can never return, all connections severed
severities.major: Long exile, return uncertain, must start over elsewhere
severities.moderate: Temporary exile with conditions for return
severities.minor: Withdrawal from public life, self-imposed distance

narrativeHooks: Driven out by those they once led
Fled before enemies could catch them
Banished by decree of higher authority
Chose exile over compromise
The land itself seemed to reject them
Stripped of titles and sent away in disgrace

transformation.description: Fundamental change in nature or identity

severities.catastrophic: Unrecognizable from former self, old identity gone
severities.major: Major aspect fundamentally changed, core identity shifted
severities.moderate: Significant shift in priorities, methods, or beliefs
severities.minor: Noticeable change in approach or outlook

narrativeHooks: Emerged from the ordeal a different person
The experience broke something inside them
They shed their old self like a snake's skin
What they saw changed them forever
The choice they made redefined who they were
They realized they had been wrong about everything

severities.major: Significant reduction in capability, shadow of former self
severities.minor: Early signs of decline, the peak is past

narrativeHooks: Age finally caught up with them
Old wounds began to take their toll
Their fire slowly dimmed
They could no longer do what once came easy
The burden of years weighed heavier each day
Their legend faded as new heroes rose

severities.catastrophic: Complete dissolution, members scattered to the winds, legacy destroyed
severities.major: Organization effectively destroyed, only remnants remain

narrativeHooks: Internal strife tore them apart
Their enemies finally united against them
The cause that bound them lost its meaning
Corruption rotted them from within
A single betrayal brought down the whole structure

severities.major: Bitter split, factions in open conflict
severities.moderate: Amicable division, factions maintain some cooperation

narrativeHooks: Two leaders claimed the right to lead
Ideological differences became irreconcilable
A succession crisis divided loyalties
Regional chapters went their own way
The old guard clashed with reformers

severities.catastrophic: Hostile takeover, identity erased, members absorbed or purged
severities.major: Merger with junior status, name may survive but independence gone

narrativeHooks: A stronger power made an offer they couldn't refuse
Survival meant surrendering independence
They were bought out by their largest rival
The merger was sold as partnership but became subjugation

decline.description: Gradual loss of influence and resources

severities.major: Major loss of territory, membership, or resources
severities.moderate: Noticeable decline in power and prestige
severities.minor: Beginning to slip, rivals gaining ground

narrativeHooks: Their best members left for other opportunities
Funding dried up as patrons lost interest
Younger organizations outcompeted them
They failed to adapt to changing times
A series of failed ventures depleted their resources

reformation.description: Fundamental change in faction nature or purpose

severities.major: Complete transformation of goals, methods, or identity
severities.moderate: Significant shift in direction or values

narrativeHooks: New leadership brought new vision
Crisis forced them to reinvent themselves
They abandoned their original purpose for survival
A revelation changed everything they believed

defeat.description: Loss in specific conflict or competition

severities.catastrophic: Total defeat, terms dictated by victors
severities.moderate: Clear loss, must regroup and recover
severities.minor: Setback, reputation damaged but organization intact

narrativeHooks: Their enemies proved stronger than expected
A crucial battle turned against them
Their strategy failed at the worst moment
Allies abandoned them when needed most

severities.catastrophic: Completely destroyed, uninhabitable, may never recover
severities.major: Largely destroyed, some remains but barely recognizable

narrativeHooks: Fire consumed everything
The earth swallowed it whole
War left nothing but ruins
A curse rendered it uninhabitable
Flood waters washed it away

conquest.description: Location changes hands to new power

severities.catastrophic: Brutal conquest, population displaced or subjugated
severities.major: Conquered, new rulers impose their will

narrativeHooks: Invaders broke through the defenses
Betrayal from within opened the gates
Siege finally succeeded after months
The rulers surrendered to spare their people
A bloodless coup changed everything overnight

severities.minor: Localized damage, disruption but recovery underway

narrativeHooks: The plague swept through without mercy
Earthquake shattered the foundations
Famine emptied the streets
A magical catastrophe twisted the land
The river broke its banks and drowned the valley

severities.minor: Beginning to fade, young people leaving

narrativeHooks: The mines ran dry
Trade routes shifted elsewhere
A better opportunity drew people away
Taxes drove out the merchants
The old industries died and nothing replaced them

severities.moderate: Significant shift in identity or role

narrativeHooks: What was sacred became profane
The forest reclaimed what was once farmland
Industry replaced the gardens
The fortress became a marketplace
Magic changed the very nature of the land

isolation.description: Location cut off from the world

severities.major: Completely unreachable, forgotten by the outside
severities.minor: Increasing difficulty in travel or communication

narrativeHooks: The roads became too dangerous
A curse keeps travelers away
Political borders closed around them
The bridge collapsed and was never rebuilt
They chose to wall themselves off
